articles.title: Author Larry Liza Gifts Gospel Singer Mary Atieno KSh 11m Mansion He Built after Taking Loan
articles.source: Breaking NEWS in KENYA for Today Right Now & Kenyan News | TUKO
articles.description: Legendary gospel singer Mary Atieno has been gifted a KSh 11m mansion built by a Kenyan author who took a loan for the project. The house is, however, unfurnished.
articles.content:
• Veteran gospel singer Mary Atieno now has a place she can call home after she was gifted a KSh 11 million mansion
  • Author Larry Liza, on Saturday, February 7, handed keys for a four-be… [+3858 chars]
articles.author: Zipporah Weru

articles.title: Why all Kenyans must unite to stop cervical cancer
articles.description: What makes cervical cancer unique is that it is both preventable and treatable through HPV vaccination and early detection via effective screening.
articles.content:
Several countries have demonstrated that cervical cancer elimination is achievable, especially among vaccinated cohorts of women. [iStockphoto]
Every day, mothers, daughters and sisters in Kenya los… [+3375 chars]

articles.title: Lucy Natasha Spotted Enjoying Warm Conversation with Oburu Oginga, Video Warms Hearts

articles.description: Reverend Lucy Natasha shared a video showing moments with Oburu Oginga a day after she met President Salva Kiir. Netizens commended her for her moves.

articles.title: Mombasa port cargo outperforms forecasts amid lingering congestion
articles.description: Kenya Ports Authority says cargo volumes through the Mombasa port hit a high record 45.45 million metric tonnes in 2025, up from 40.99 million tonnes processed at the facility in 2024.
articles.content:
Cranes offloading containers from MV Jolly Giada LOA at the Port of Mombasa on March 6, 2024. [File, Standard]
Cargo volumes through the port of Mombasa hit a new high in 2025 as the facility grappl… [+5544 chars]

articles.title: Kenya faces rising paediatric cancer cases
articles.description: Data from KUTRRH indicates that paediatric cancer is a growing health challenge in Kenya, with an estimated 3,200 new cases diagnosed among children and adolescents each year.
articles.content:
Moi Teaching and Referral Hospital staff led by CEO Wilson Aruasa, march in Eldoret town to create awareness about multiple myeloma cancer. [File, Standard]
